intro: Alloplectus, commonly known as the groundsel or common groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. Alloplectus species typically have basal rosettes of leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are often yellow or white in color. They are native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and many species are considered weeds in agricultural settings. Alloplectus plants are generally herbaceous and can thrive in a variety of soil types, though they prefer well-drained conditions.
